light.$description: Light theme overlay (50% opacity). Use for: modal backdrops, drawer overlays on light backgrounds.

dark.$description: Dark theme overlay (75% opacity). Use for: modal backdrops on dark backgrounds, higher contrast overlays.

text.$description: Primary text color (#000000 in light theme). Use for: headings, body text, labels, primary content. HIGHEST contrast against body background. WCAG AAA compliant (21:1 contrast ratio). Common in: Typography, labels, form field values, card content, navigation text.

body.$description: Body/page background color (#FFFFFF in light theme). Use for: main page background, card backgrounds, content area base. FOUNDATIONAL surface color - everything else layers on top. Common in: App shell background, Card, Paper, Modal content area, page wrappers.

bright.$description: Bright/emphasis text color. In light theme, same as text (black). Use for: highest emphasis content, key figures, critical information, visual hierarchy peaks. Provides flexibility for themes where bright differs from text. Common in: Dashboard metrics, highlighted text, key stats.

error.$description: Error state text color (red.7). WCAG AA compliant with 6.02:1 contrast ratio against white. Use for: error messages, validation failures, destructive action warnings, critical alerts. ACCESSIBILITY: Combine with an icon - don't rely on color alone to convey errors. Common in: Form validation errors, Alert (error variant), Toast (error), inline error messages.

placeholder.$description: Placeholder text color (gray.6). WCAG AA-large text compliant with 3.32:1 contrast. Use for: input placeholder text, empty state hints, secondary guidance text. CAUTION: Not suitable for essential information - only use for hints that enhance, not provide, meaning. Common in: Input placeholders, Select placeholder, search hints, empty state descriptions.

anchor.$description: Anchor/link text color (blue.6). Use for: hyperlinks, clickable text, text buttons, navigation links. Must be distinguishable from surrounding text. ACCESSIBILITY: Ensure 3:1 contrast against non-link text per WCAG 1.4.1. Underline recommended for in-paragraph links. Common in: Anchor elements, text-style buttons, breadcrumb links, inline navigation.

default.$description: Default surface/background color for components. Use for: button backgrounds, input backgrounds, card surfaces, component base layer. Provides neutral canvas for content. Common in: Button (default variant), Input background, Card surface, Dropdown trigger, Tab panels.

default-hover.$description: Default hover background color (gray.0 - very light gray). Use for: hover states on default surfaces, interactive row highlights, button hover feedback. Provides subtle visual feedback without dramatic color shift. Common in: Button:hover, Table row:hover, List item:hover, Menu item:hover, Dropdown option:hover.

default-color.$description: Default text color for default-background components. Use for: button text, input text, component labels. Pairs with 'default' background for proper contrast. Common in: Button text, Input value, Tab label, Menu item text, Badge text.

default-border.$description: Default border color (gray.4 - medium gray). Use for: input borders, card boundaries, component outlines, dividers. Provides subtle definition without harsh contrast. Common in: Input border, Card border, Table cell borders, Divider lines, Tab container borders.

dimmed.$description: Dimmed/muted text color (gray.6). Use for: secondary text, metadata, timestamps, captions, helper text, de-emphasized content. Lower contrast than primary text to establish visual hierarchy. ACCESSIBILITY: Ensure still meets minimum 4.5:1 contrast for small text. Common in: Timestamps, bylines, helper text, secondary labels, metadata.

disabled.$description: Disabled element background color (gray.2 - light gray). Use for: disabled button backgrounds, inactive input backgrounds, unavailable component surfaces. Visually indicates non-interactivity. ACCESSIBILITY: Use with aria-disabled='true'. Color alone is not sufficient - combine with disabled-color text. Common in: Button:disabled background, Input:disabled background, disabled toggle/switch.

disabled-color.$description: Disabled element text color (gray.5). Use for: disabled button text, inactive labels, unavailable option text. Reduced contrast indicates non-interactivity. ACCESSIBILITY: Disabled elements are exempt from WCAG contrast requirements BUT should still be perceivable. Pairs with 'disabled' background. Common in: Button:disabled text, Select:disabled option, disabled form label.

disabled-border.$description: Disabled element border color (gray.3). Use for: disabled input borders, inactive component outlines. Completes the disabled state trio (disabled, disabled-color, disabled-border). Common in: Input:disabled border, Button:disabled outline, disabled Card border.

0.$description: Primary shade 0 - lightest. Use for: very subtle backgrounds, light hover states, table zebra striping with primary tint. Nearly white with a hint of primary. Common in: Light info backgrounds, subtle selected states.

1.$description: Primary shade 1. Use for: light backgrounds, subtle emphasis, secondary selections. Noticeably tinted but still light. Common in: Info panel backgrounds, light chips/tags.

2.$description: Primary shade 2. Use for: hover states on shade 1 backgrounds, light borders, subtle dividers. Common in: Card hover with primary tint, light accent borders.

3.$description: Primary shade 3. Use for: visible but soft accents, disabled primary buttons, light mode decorative elements. Common in: Progress bar tracks, light decorative borders.

4.$description: Primary shade 4. Use for: medium-light accents, dark theme primary button backgrounds. Balanced between light and saturated. Common in: Icons on light backgrounds, secondary badges.

5.$description: Primary shade 5. Use for: focus rings, medium emphasis accents, link hover states. Middle of the primary scale. Common in: Focus ring color, interactive element outlines.

6.$description: Primary shade 6 - PRIMARY INTERACTIVE. Main shade for buttons and interactive elements in light theme. Use for: primary buttons, links, active states. WCAG AA compliant against white backgrounds. Common in: Button (primary), Anchor, Checkbox:checked, Radio:selected.

7.$description: Primary shade 7. Use for: primary button hover, pressed states, darker accents. Darker than interactive shade for state differentiation. Common in: Button (primary):hover, pressed states, dark accents.

8.$description: Primary shade 8. Use for: active/pressed states, high-contrast accents on light backgrounds. Quite dark - use sparingly. Common in: Active button states, high emphasis borders.

9.$description: Primary shade 9 - darkest primary. Use for: extreme emphasis, near-black primary tints, dark theme text on primary backgrounds. Very dark - maximum primary saturation. Common in: Dark mode primary text, high contrast accents.

filled.$description: Primary filled background color. Use for: primary button backgrounds, selected toggles, active tabs, main CTAs. This is the HERO primary color - highest brand visibility. ACCESSIBILITY: Use with primary.contrast text for proper contrast. Common in: Button (primary), active Tab, selected Checkbox/Radio, primary Badge.

filled-hover.$description: Primary filled hover state background. Use for: primary button hover, active element hover feedback. Slightly darker than filled for visible hover response. Common in: Button (primary):hover, active Tab:hover, primary action hover states.

light.$description: Primary light/subtle background color. Use for: subtle primary emphasis, light variant buttons, selected row backgrounds, info alerts. Lower visual weight than filled - use for secondary primary actions. Common in: Button (primary light variant), selected Table row, Alert (info), Tag/Chip (primary).

light-hover.$description: Primary light hover state background. Use for: light primary button hover, selected row hover. Slightly darker than light for hover feedback. Common in: Button (primary light):hover, selected row:hover.

light-color.$description: Text color for use ON primary.light backgrounds. Use for: text in light primary buttons, labels in info alerts, icons on light primary surfaces. Ensures readable contrast on subtle primary backgrounds. Common in: Button (primary light) text, Alert (info) text, light primary Badge text.

contrast.$description: Contrast text color for use ON primary.filled backgrounds. White in light theme. Use for: primary button text, icons on primary backgrounds, text overlaid on brand colors. CRITICAL for accessibility - ensures readable text on primary surfaces. Common in: Button (primary) text/icon, primary Badge text, primary Chip text.

0.$description: Fully transparent (0%). Use for: hidden elements, animation start states, invisible interactive areas. Element is invisible but may still be interactive. CSS: opacity: 0; visibility: hidden for truly hidden.

5.$description: 5% opacity - barely visible. Use for: extremely subtle hover states, ghost backgrounds, near-invisible separators. Only visible against high-contrast backgrounds.

10.$description: 10% opacity - subtle transparency. Use for: light hover backgrounds, subtle shadows, faint overlays. Minimally perceptible change.

20.$description: 20% opacity - light transparency. Use for: hover states, light overlays, muted backgrounds. Noticeable but unobtrusive.

25.$description: 25% opacity - quarter visible. Use for: skeleton loading states, light dimming, subtle backgrounds. Common for placeholder content.

30.$description: 30% opacity - moderate transparency. Use for: image overlays, text shadows, moderate dimming. Visible but allows content behind to show clearly.

40.$description: 40% opacity - semi-transparent. Use for: medium overlays, watermarks, partially hidden content. Balanced visibility.

50.$description: 50% opacity - half visible. Use for: disabled elements (semantic alias: 'disabled'), balanced overlays, de-emphasized content. CAUTION: May not meet contrast requirements for text.

60.$description: 60% opacity - mostly visible. Use for: modal backdrops (semantic alias: 'overlay'), dimmed backgrounds, focus-drawing overlays. Content behind is visible but de-emphasized.

70.$description: 70% opacity - high visibility. Use for: heavy overlays, strong dimming, de-emphasized backgrounds. Most content visible but clearly secondary.

75.$description: 75% opacity - three-quarters visible. Use for: dark overlays, strong backgrounds, significant dimming. Mostly solid with hint of transparency.

80.$description: 80% opacity - mostly solid. Use for: nearly-opaque overlays, frosted glass effects (with backdrop-filter), heavy backgrounds.

90.$description: 90% opacity - nearly solid. Use for: subtle transparency effects, slight see-through, glass-like surfaces. Almost indistinguishable from solid.

100.$description: Fully opaque (100%). Use for: solid elements, removing inherited transparency, default element state. CSS: opacity: 1; (default browser value).

disabled.$description: Disabled element opacity (50%). SEMANTIC alias for opacity.50. Use for: disabled buttons, inactive controls, unavailable options. Universally recognized as 'inactive'. ACCESSIBILITY: Ensure disabled elements are still perceivable and their disabled state is communicated via aria-disabled.

overlay.$description: Modal overlay opacity (60%). SEMANTIC alias for opacity.60. Use for: modal backdrops, lightbox backgrounds, focus-drawing overlays. Dims background while keeping it visible for context. Common in: Modal backdrop, Drawer overlay, image lightbox backgrounds.

scale.$description: Global scale factor for Mantine components. 1 = default size, 0.8 = 80% size, 1.2 = 120% size.

cursorType.$description: Cursor style for interactive elements. 'pointer' for clickable, 'default' for standard.

webkitFontSmoothing.$description: WebKit font smoothing. 'antialiased' for crisp text on macOS/iOS.

mozFontSmoothing.$description: Mozilla font smoothing. 'grayscale' for crisp text on Firefox.

headingFontWeight.$description: Default font weight for all headings (h1-h6).

headingTextWrap.$description: Text wrapping behavior for headings. 'wrap' allows line breaks, 'balance' balances lines.

radiusDefault.$description: Default border radius when no size is specified. References radius.sm token.

text.$description: Text color for dark theme elements

filled-hover.$description: Hover state for dark filled elements

light.$description: Light variant of dark color, equal to applying 0.1 opacity to colorPalette.dark.6

light-hover.$description: Hover state for dark light elements, equal to applying 0.12 opacity to colorPalette.dark.6

light-color.$description: Text color for dark light elements

outline-hover.$description: Hover state for dark outline elements

text.$description: Text color for gray theme elements

filled-hover.$description: Hover state for gray filled elements

light-hover.$description: Hover state for gray light elements

light-color.$description: Text color for gray light elements

outline-hover.$description: Hover state for gray outline elements

text.$description: Text color for red theme elements

filled-hover.$description: Hover state for red filled elements

light-hover.$description: Hover state for red light elements

light-color.$description: Text color for red light elements

outline-hover.$description: Hover state for red outline elements

filled-hover.$description: Hover state for pink filled elements

light-hover.$description: Hover state for pink light elements

light-color.$description: Text color for pink light elements

outline-hover.$description: Hover state for pink outline elements

filled-hover.$description: Hover state for cyan filled elements

light-hover.$description: Hover state for cyan light elements

light-color.$description: Text color for cyan light elements

outline-hover.$description: Hover state for cyan outline elements

filled-hover.$description: Hover state for teal filled elements

light-hover.$description: Hover state for teal light elements

light-color.$description: Text color for teal light elements

outline-hover.$description: Hover state for teal outline elements

text.$description: Text color for green theme elements

filled-hover.$description: Hover state for green filled elements

light-hover.$description: Hover state for green light elements

light-color.$description: Text color for green light elements

text.$description: Text color for lime theme elements

filled-hover.$description: Hover state for lime filled elements

light-hover.$description: Hover state for lime light elements

light-hover.$description: Hover state for yellow light elements

outline-hover.$description: Hover state for yellow outline elements

text.$description: Text color for orange theme elements

filled-hover.$description: Hover state for orange filled elements

light-hover.$description: Hover state for orange light elements

light-color.$description: Text color for orange light elements

outline-hover.$description: Hover state for orange outline elements

backgroundColor.$description: Filled button background color. Uses primary color.

textColor.$description: Filled button text color. White for contrast on primary.

borderColor.$description: Outline button border color. Uses primary color.

textColor.$description: Outline button text color. Uses primary color.

backgroundColor.$description: Subtle button background color. Transparent by default.

text.$description: Default component text color
Disabled state text color
Error state text color
Success state text color
Warning state text color (darker for contrast)
Info state text color
Selected state text color
